Doctors, firm pay $140,000 penalty for tossed records

The pile found by a Globe photographer in July 2010 included records for more than 67,000 people who had data kept by a medical billing practice. (Boston Globe)
  • 8/13/10 Patients’ files left at public dump

Murray outraises other Mass. officials

Lieutenant Governor Timothy Murray's $447,000 in raised contributions offers more evidence that he's preparing for a gubernatorial run in 2014. (AP)

Rondo suspended a game for contact with ref and not cooperating afterward

Celtics guard Rajon Rondo served his suspension in tonight's Knicks game after making contact with an official during Saturday's game and for failure to cooperate with an investigation. (Boston Globe)
  • Pictures Rondo being Rondo | Game updates | More

Chronic drunk driver held without bail

William Doten, 65, pleaded not guilty today after being stopped in Avon to what was at least his ninth charge of driving under the influence. (Boston Globe)

Changes to the alimony law in Massachusetts

Besides an update in the 1970s, the state's antiquated alimony law dated back to the 16th century. That changed with a reform to the law last year. Take a look at what's different.
